item.title: Bernard Arnault’s son to take up new job leading LVMH’s struggling drinks division
item.description: Tiffany & Co executive Alexandre Arnault, 32, will take up a new position as Deputy CEO of LVMH’s wine & spirits division in February 2025

item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy after tumultuous period in which two attempted mergers fell through
item.description: Spirit Airlines Inc. filed for a voluntary, pre-arranged Chapter 11 bankruptcy early Monday, capping a tumultuous period for the low-cost airline in w...

item.title: Oil prices rise after U.S. approves Ukraine use of long-range missiles inside Russia
item.description: Oil futures were finding some buying interest Monday morning after a weekend decision by President Joe Biden to allow Ukraine to use U.S.-supplied lon...

item.title: ‘I handle my dad’s finances’: My father is in a nursing home and will get $100K in compensation. What should I do with it?
item.description: “I’ve thought about CDs, money-market and mutual funds.”

item.title: ‘I can’t deal with managing them’: I juggle 18 credit cards. How do I close them without ruining my credit score?
item.description: “I have very high limits, so charges barely make a blip on my credit-utilization ratio.”
